# Project Scope Statement

**Generated by Requirements Gathering Agent v2.1.2**

## Document Purpose

This Project Scope Statement defines the scope, boundaries, deliverables, and explicit exclusions for the ADPA project. It establishes the basis for all scope management, project planning, and change control. All stakeholders must review this document to align expectations and prevent scope creep.

**PMBOK Reference:** 5.3.3.1 - Project Scope Statement

---

## 1. Project Overview

**Project Name:** ADPA – Advanced Document Processing & Automation Framework  
**Project Code/Version:** adpa-enterprise-framework-automation v3.2.4

**Project Description:**  
ADPA is a modular, standards-compliant Node.js/TypeScript automation framework that delivers enterprise-grade, AI-powered document generation, project management, and business analysis automation. The system provides both CLI and REST API interfaces for generating professional documentation aligned with BABOK v3, PMBOK 7th Edition, and DMBOK 2.0 standards. It is designed for secure, scalable, maintainable enterprise automation, with production-ready Express.js API and TypeSpec architecture.

---

## 2. Project Scope Description

### 2.1 Project Purpose and Justification

The purpose of the ADPA project is to provide enterprises with a unified, standard-compliant automation framework to streamline requirements management, project documentation, and data governance processes. It addresses the need for consistent, high-quality, and audit-ready documentation across business analysis, project management, and data management domains, supporting regulatory compliance and operational efficiency.

**Business Value:**  
- Accelerates project initiation and planning phases  
- Reduces manual effort and errors in documentation  
- Ensures compliance with industry standards and regulations  
- Supports enterprise integration and scalability

### 2.2 Product Scope Description

ADPA will deliver a modular software framework supporting:  
- Standards-based document generation (BABOK, PMBOK, DMBOK)  
- AI-powered automation for requirements, project, and data management  
- CLI, REST API, and web admin interfaces  
- Integration with Confluence, SharePoint, Adobe Document Services  
- Enterprise security, authentication, and compliance features

### 2.3 Project Objectives

- Deliver a production-ready, standards-compliant automation framework (Node.js/TypeScript)
- Enable end-to-end document generation pipelines for business analysis, project management, and data governance
- Provide multi-provider AI integration with automatic failover (OpenAI, Google AI, GitHub Copilot, Ollama)
- Support REST API and CLI interactions for document generation and integration
- Achieve enterprise-grade security and regulatory compliance (GDPR, SOX, PCI DSS, etc.)
- Facilitate integrations with major enterprise platforms (Confluence, SharePoint, Active Directory)

---

## 3. Project Deliverables

### 3.1 Primary Deliverables

- **ADPA Core Framework:** Modular Node.js/TypeScript codebase with CLI tools and REST API server
- **AI Integration Module:** Multi-provider orchestration supporting OpenAI, Google AI, GitHub Copilot, Ollama
- **Document Generator:** Template-based, standards-compliant document creation engine
- **Integration Layer:** Connectors for Atlassian Confluence, Microsoft SharePoint, Adobe Document Services
- **Admin Web Interface:** Next.js-based management portal for configuration and monitoring
- **API Specification:** TypeSpec/OpenAPI 3.0 documentation for integration and automation

### 3.2 Secondary Deliverables

- **Comprehensive Documentation:** User guides, API docs, CLI quick reference, developer onboarding
- **Testing Suite:** Unit, integration, and performance tests (Jest-based)
- **Configuration Templates:** Environment setup guides and .env templates
- **Sample Artifacts:** Example output documents for BABOK, PMBOK, and DMBOK standards
- **Analytics & Reporting Module:** Usage metrics and compliance insights

### 3.3 Deliverable Acceptance Criteria

- All primary modules must pass automated testing (>90% coverage, zero critical bugs)
- REST API must comply with published TypeSpec/OpenAPI documentation
- Document generator must produce valid, standard-compliant outputs for BABOK v3, PMBOK 7, DMBOK 2.0
- Integration connectors must successfully execute standard workflows (publish to Confluence/SharePoint, generate PDFs)
- User, admin, and developer documentation must be complete and reviewed by project stakeholders

---

## 4. Scope Boundaries

### 4.1 In Scope

- Implementation of Node.js/TypeScript modular framework (CLI, API, web portal)
- AI-powered standards-based document generation (BABOK, PMBOK, DMBOK)
- Integration with Confluence, SharePoint, Adobe Document Services
- Enterprise authentication (API key, JWT, Entra ID in roadmap)
- Automated test coverage and documentation
- Support for Node.js v18+, TypeScript v5.7+, Next.js 14/React 18 frontend

### 4.2 Explicit Exclusions (Out of Scope)

#### 4.2.1 Functional Exclusions

- **No mobile application:** Mobile app interfaces for iOS/Android are not included in this release
- **No real-time collaboration:** Live multi-user editing or chat functionality is excluded
- **No end-user workflow automation:** Custom non-document workflow automation (e.g., ticketing, CRM) is not delivered
- **No direct support for non-English document templates:** Only English-language templates are included; localization is excluded

#### 4.2.2 Technical Exclusions

- **No support for legacy Node.js (<v18) or TypeScript (<v5.7):** Framework is not tested or supported on older versions
- **No on-premises deployment guides:** Only cloud and container (future) deployment patterns are supported
- **No native mobile SDKs:** No SDKs or wrappers for iOS/Android
- **No direct integration with non-listed AI providers:** Only OpenAI, Google AI, GitHub Copilot, and Ollama are supported

#### 4.2.3 Business Process Exclusions

- **No organization-wide change management:** Broader process re-engineering, change management strategies, or training programs are not included
- **No in-depth end-user training:** Only basic admin and developer documentation is provided; formal classroom or virtual training is excluded
- **No business process consulting:** The framework does not include consulting services for requirements management, project management, or data governance

#### 4.2.4 Data and Content Exclusions

- **No legacy data migration:** Migration of existing documents or data into the new system is not part of scope
- **No large-scale content cleanup:** Bulk data cleansing, content deduplication, or taxonomy alignment outside document generation outputs is excluded
- **No custom content creation:** Only template-based, standards-driven documents are generated; custom/creative writing services are not included

#### 4.2.5 Infrastructure and Environment Exclusions

- **No physical hardware procurement:** Project does not provide physical servers, networking equipment, or storage
- **No customer-specific cloud setup:** ADPA does not provision or configure a customer’s cloud environment (e.g., AWS, Azure subscriptions)
- **No on-premises security hardening:** Security configuration is limited to application-level; infrastructure-level security is the client’s responsibility
- **No production Kubernetes templates (current release):** Kubernetes support is roadmap only; not delivered in this phase

#### 4.2.6 Support and Maintenance Exclusions

- **No 24/7 operational support:** Ongoing managed services, incident response, or SLA-based support are excluded
- **No long-term maintenance contracts:** Only initial bug-fix support during warranty period; extended support requires a separate agreement
- **No user account administration:** User provisioning and identity management are limited to technical documentation; hands-on administration is excluded

#### 4.2.7 Future Phase Exclusions

- **Docker containerization:** Docker images and orchestration templates are planned but not included in this delivery
- **Kubernetes deployment:** Helm charts and K8s templates are roadmap only
- **Enterprise SSO integration:** Advanced SSO and multi-factor authentication using Entra ID is planned for future releases
- **Advanced workflow automation:** Workflow builder and process orchestration will come in later phases
- **Mobile app support:** Native or PWA mobile applications are future roadmap items
- **Real-time editing/collaboration:** Collaborative document editing is not included in the current scope
- **Advanced analytics dashboard:** Planned for post-initial-release

### 4.3 Scope Clarifications

- **Integration is limited to documented connectors:** Only Confluence, SharePoint, and Adobe Document Services are supported for integration; Jira, ServiceNow, FileNet, and other platforms require separate evaluation or future roadmap.
- **Security covers application-level controls:** Enterprise security features (API authentication, RBAC, JWT) are included, but customer is responsible for infrastructure/network security and compliance audits.
- **Only standards-based document types are provided:** No custom business process templates unless aligned to BABOK, PMBOK, or DMBOK.
- **CLI and API are the main user interfaces:** Admin web portal is for configuration; no user-facing portal for document consumption.

---

## 5. Project Requirements

### 5.1 Functional Requirements

- Generate documentation aligned with BABOK v3, PMBOK 7, DMBOK 2.0 using AI-powered engines
- Provide REST API and CLI interfaces for document generation, integration, and configuration
- Support multi-provider AI (OpenAI, Google AI, GitHub Copilot, Ollama) with failover
- Integrate with Confluence and SharePoint for document publishing
- Enable admin configuration via web interface

### 5.2 Non-Functional Requirements

- Ensure system is secure (JWT, API key, RBAC)
- Achieve >99% uptime for core API components
- Support horizontal scaling through microservices architecture
- Maintain high performance for document generation (<30s per standard document on typical hardware)
- Provide comprehensive logging, monitoring, and audit trails

### 5.3 Quality Requirements

- Automated test coverage >90%
- All critical and high-severity defects resolved prior to release
- Documentation reviewed and approved by stakeholders
- Compliance with PMBOK, BABOK, DMBOK, and applicable regulatory standards

---

## 6. Project Constraints

### 6.1 Technical Constraints

- Node.js v18+ and TypeScript v5.7+ required
- Only listed AI providers (OpenAI, Google AI, GitHub Copilot, Ollama) supported
- Limited to web and CLI interfaces; no desktop or mobile apps in this phase

### 6.2 Resource Constraints

- Delivery within approved project budget and timeline
- Dedicated development team with Node.js/TypeScript expertise
- Limited external consulting or managed services

### 6.3 Environmental Constraints

- Must support deployment in enterprise cloud or on-prem as per documentation
- Integration limited to published connectors and APIs
- Compliance requirements (GDPR, SOX, PCI DSS) must be met at application layer

---

## 7. Project Assumptions

### 7.1 Technical Assumptions

- Client will provide required API keys and credentials for AI providers and integrations
- Client infrastructure meets documented prerequisites (Node.js, network, security)
- No unsupported platforms or environments will be used

### 7.2 Business Assumptions

- Stakeholders will review and approve standard document templates
- Client will manage change management and user training outside of this project
- Regulatory compliance requirements are known and communicated prior to implementation

### 7.3 Resource Assumptions

- Subject matter experts (SMEs) are available for standards alignment review
- Sufficient internal IT support for integration and deployment
- Stakeholder engagement available for acceptance testing

---

## 8. Success Criteria and Acceptance Criteria

### 8.1 Project Success Criteria

- All primary deliverables are accepted and meet defined acceptance criteria
- Framework is successfully deployed and operational in at least one enterprise environment
- Stakeholders confirm alignment with standards (BABOK, PMBOK, DMBOK) and regulatory requirements
- No material scope or feature creep occurs

### 8.2 Product Acceptance Criteria

- All features pass user acceptance testing (UAT) and automated test suites
- Documentation is complete, accurate, and accessible
- Integration workflows (Confluence/SharePoint/Adobe) are successfully demonstrated
- Security and compliance requirements are validated by client security team

---

## 9. Scope Management Guidelines

### 9.1 Change Control Process

- All requested changes to scope must be submitted via formal change request
- Change requests are reviewed by project manager and steering committee for impact analysis
- Approved changes are documented and integrated into project plan; re-baseline as needed

### 9.2 Exclusion Communication

- All explicit exclusions are communicated to stakeholders during project kickoff, UAT, and prior to release
- FAQ and stakeholder briefings will reinforce exclusions and out-of-scope items

### 9.3 Scope Validation Process

- Scope and deliverables are validated with key stakeholders at each major milestone (design, UAT, release)
- Exclusions and boundaries are reviewed and signed off as part of acceptance process
